channel.title: BBC Sport | Other Sports | Horse Racing | UK Edition
channel.description: The latest BBC Horse Racing news plus comment, analysis, results, calendar, tic-tac guide, racecards guide, audio and video.
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/help/rss/4517815.stm for terms and conditions of reuse

item.title: Aintree fences 'should be bigger'
item.description: Trainer Malcolm Jefferson believes bigger fences at the Grand National could have saved his horse According to Pete.

item.title: £1m offered for Frankel v Caviar
item.description: A prize fund of £1m is being used as bait in an attempt to secure a clash between Frankel and Black Caviar in the Sussex Stakes at Goodwood.

item.title: Sir Alex in Scottish National bid
item.description: Sir Alex Ferguson's Harry The Viking is among the likely runners at the Scottish Grand National.

item.title: Monterosso wins Dubai World Cup
item.description: Monterosso, ridden by Mickael Barzalona, eases to victory in the Dubai World Cup, the world's richest horse race.

item.title: Favourite to miss Grand National
item.description: A hip fracture rules bookies' favourite Prince De Beauchene out of the Grand National on 14 April.

item.title: Brae Hill wins Lincoln Handicap
item.description: Brae Hill holds off the challenge of Mull of Killough to win the Lincoln Handicap in a thrilling finish at Doncaster.

item.title: Horse racing on the BBC
item.description: Details of horse racing coverage on the BBC

item.title: Fanning claims all-weather title
item.description: A double at Lingfield sees Joe Fanning win the all-weather jockeys' championship, defeating Luke Morris 89-86 on the final day.

item.title: Top stallion Montjeu dies aged 16
item.description: Montjeu, who sired three Epsom Derby winners, dies at the age of 16 following a short illness.

item.title: Hughes loses 50-day ban appeal
item.description: Top jockey Richard Hughes will miss the first month of the new Flat season after he failed to overturn a 50-day ban incurred in India.

item.title: National winner Lee switches to Flat
item.description: Grand National-winning jockey Graham Lee cites weight issues as his main reason for switching codes to Flat racing.

item.title: Synchronised still on course for National
item.description: Cheltenham Gold Cup winner Synchronised has a chance to complete a rare double after remaining among the Grand National entries.

item.title: Winter Derby win for Premio Loco
item.description: Premio Loco comes through in the home straight to win the Winter Derby at Lingfield, with Cai Shen second and Circumvent third.

item.title: Women jockeys to race for title
item.description: A championship for female jockeys - spearheaded by Hayley Turner - is to be launched for the new flat racing season.

item.title: No hurry on Kauto Star - Nicholls
item.description: Talk of retiring two-time Cheltenham Gold Cup winner Kauto Star would be "very premature", says trainer Paul Nicholls.
